definitions.definition: a part of a fence or outside wall that is fixed at one side and opens and closes like a door, usually made of metal or wooden strips
a similar device that slides across an opening, often folding into a smaller space as it is opened:
examples: The lift won't move if the safety gate isn't shut properly.

definitions.definition: a part of an airport where travellers are allowed to get on or off a particular aircraft:
examples: All passengers for flight LH103 please proceed to gate 16.
